TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HttpBrowserCapabilities extends System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase

Docs.summary: Enables the server to gather information on the capabilities of the browser that is running on the client.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> properties are accessible through the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.Browser%2A> property of the ASP.NET intrinsic <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Request%2A> object.

Docs.related: ASP.NET Server Controls and Browser Capabilities

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Version As String
public: property System::String ^ Version { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the full version number (integer and decimal) of the browser as a string.
Docs.value: The full version number of the browser, as a string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The `Version` property returns a string. In some scenarios, `Version` might contain letter characters, as in the case of a browser or client device that is a beta version such as "7.0b." To correctly get the version as a data type that can be used in a numeric comparison, concatenate the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities.MajorVersion> and <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities.MinorVersion> property values.
